definition: tender and soft as water/deeply attached to sb
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: I loved you tenderness and candor.
sentences.chinese: 我曾柔情似水满怀真挚地爱过你。

sentences.english: The cardigans and leggings as soft as silk endow ladies with particular charm.
sentences.chinese: 柔情似水的毛衣裙装赋予女性独特的魅力。

sentences.english: Perhaps the city's too fast, so even the less love the original gentle enough.
sentences.chinese: 也许城市的太快了，所以即便的少爱原来的柔情似水。

sentences.english: It sounded both familiar and exotic, feminine yet strong.
sentences.chinese: 听来情切又不失异国风情，柔情似水又坚强有力。

sentences.english: I made shoulder strong enough to carry the weight of the world. Yet, gentle enough to give comfort.
sentences.chinese: 我使她的肩膀能挑起整个世界的重担，并且柔情似水。

sentences.english: I made her shoulders strong enough to carry the weight of the world; yet , gentle enough to give comfort.
sentences.chinese: 我使她的肩膀能挑起整个世界的重担，并且柔情似水。

sentences.english: People usually think Chinese women are always gentle.
sentences.chinese: 人们通常认为中国女性总是柔情似水。

sentences.english: As a woman, she is as sweet as honey too.
sentences.chinese: 作为女人，她也有情意缠绵，柔情似水的一面。

sentences.english: I made shoulder strong enough to carry the weight of the world.
sentences.chinese: 我使她的肩膀能挑起整个世界的重担，并且柔情似水。

definition: as cold as ice and frost (idiom, usually of woman); icy manner/frigid
